page.title: 18St.Johns Church
page.content: St.Johns church was built in 1189.It's first record dates back to 1735.When it was first built the roof was made of parchment and the walls were made of rough stone,but now the walls are smooth and the roof is beautiful. The congregation of St.Johns is 100 people and has not risen since 1980, but it used to seat 176 people.The church was in need of restoration and a vicar raised Â£900 to do so.The church bell that calls the people to church has been there since 1637 and was presented by William Matthew, Squire of Glamorgan,who is now buried with his family in the graveyard.Up to 1643 people were buried under the church floor.In 1972 when the church was having a new floor the builders found the remains of Mary Rees.
